english: to recharge; to top up; to add value; top-up

etymology.description: 充 ‘fill/charge’ + 值 ‘value’ = add value/top up.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “fill value,” used for adding prepaid credit to phones, transport cards, games, or digital wallets. By extension, it can also refer to the top-up amount itself.

examples.chinese: 我需要给手机话费充值(我需要給手機話費充值)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xūyào gěi shǒujī huàfèi chōngzhí.
examples.english: I need to top up my mobile phone credit.

examples.chinese: 他在网上银行给账户充值，很方便(他在網上銀行給帳戶充值，很方便)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài wǎngshàng yínháng gěi zhànghù chōngzhí, hěn fāngbiàn.
examples.english: He recharges his account via online banking; it’s very convenient.

examples.chinese: 这个游戏要求先充值才能解锁新关卡(這個遊戲要求先充值才能解鎖新關卡)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège yóuxì yāoqiú xiān chōngzhí cáinéng jiěsuǒ xīn guānkǎ.
examples.english: This game requires a top-up before new levels can be unlocked.
